data.title: Fabulous service, good food.
data.text: Chapalas is a wonderful family environment with good food. Where they shine is in their service. While we're only going about once a month Maria still recognizes us and remembers what our favorites are on the menu. I will always feel comfortable recommending chapalas to anybody who wanted to have the standard assortment of Mexican foods.

data.title: Best food since Costa Maya
data.text: The food was so flavorful and cooked perfectly. I had the pork carnitas and my husband has the burrito de carne asada. Both of us had left overs due to great portions. Then there is the service. The waitress and her assisting staff were wonderful and so attentive from the minute we were seated taking drink orders until after we paid and sat and finished our drink while visiting. Clean and quiet atmosphere close to closing. Best Mexican food since our vacation in Costa Maya. Definitely a new tradition on our trips to Southern ID.

data.title: Always a good meal
data.text: We eat at Chapala's frequently. Great staff. They have come to know our Pastor and his family as well as many other church members. The fun part is asking for them to surprise us with a dish. We never go wrong and always have a delicious meal.

data.title: Good Mexican food in Nampa!
data.text: Nice atmosphere, good Mexican food served by pleasant wait staff!  The chips served before the meal come with salsa and also a bowl of beans--very tasty!  Everything from taco salads to combination plates on the extensive menu.  Kids menu items and some American food items available. Everything we've tried here is good!  Enjoy the variety!  Good place to meet friends for lunch (groups up to 20 or so can be handled).  Reservations accepted.

data.title: Americanized Mexican Food
data.text: Whenever I eat here I leave feeling disappointed that I didn't really enjoy good Mexican food.  The food is ok, but nothing special and it is very Americanized.  The service is good but the food is lacking that Mexican food deliciousness I crave.

data.title: The Best
data.text: The Best Around.  The Best Service around.  The Best Manager around.  This place is one of my families favorite I have been going here for about 11 years.  Is it authentic somewhat, but it is Americanized.  Ones that aren't don't seem to do well around here.  I however do like the more authentic and if you ask they will hook you up.  If you have a issue the Manager will take care of you.  The staff are great.  The prices can be a little high, but meals are big enough to split.

data.title: Decent food, fair prices
data.text: This restaurant offers a fair range of Mexican entrees. The service is typically decent and the food is okay - it's not top tier, but neither are the prices. They provide chips/dips as a part of the meal, and a free refill on many of the more common beverages. I like their lemonade myself.

data.title: Adequate but menu lacking in "the basics"
data.text: My brothers and father came here for a little outing. We were immediately put-off by the fact that they had locked the doors 30 minutes prior to closing we have us attitude about opening them again. Thankfully the manager was there as instructed the Employees.  I've never been to a Mexican restaurant (Tex mex) that didn't have either queso dip or the melted cheese on a platter.  Chapala doesn't. They said they stopped serving it.  The guacamole was great, the chips were some of the best I've ever eaten and the salsa was decent. But where is the queso?!!! Food wasn't anything remarkable.  Very dry chicken breast.  Others orders were claimed to be quite good.  Would come here again if they bring back the option for queso dip.

data.title: Best Mexican food
data.text: The food is great and so is the service. We have never had a bad meal there for Breakfast or lunch. The restaurant is clean and so are the bathrooms.

data.title: Very Good
data.text: I ate at this location with a work associate. The service was outstanding. The food was very good and fresh. This was the first time that I have eaten at this location and I will be back in the future.

data.title: Not returning
data.text: We used to go here a lot, as it was kid & family friendly.  The food portions starting getting smaller, and the meats were lousy.  Sorry to find that it has deteriorated.

data.title: Pretty good Mexican Food
data.text: It is really hard to find authentic Mexican food in Idaho, however, this was pretty good all things considered.  The beans were nothing to write home about, but the chips and salsa were good and the tacos and enchiladas were very well prepared.  The staff was very friendly and the restaurant was very clean overall.   Pleasant atmosphere and a great dining experience.

data.title: Delicious food.
data.text: The chips were warm and the sauce great. The main course was very delicious. The servers were very attentive but not intrusive.

data.title: Not Bad For Idaho!
data.text: Had lunch there last week and thought it was pretty good for Idaho. After living 15 miles north of the Baja border for 55 years, myself and fellow CA refugee thought the food was pretty good. Service was better than most. Our drinks and chips were replaced quickly along with the bean dip. Food was the best I have had since moving here 2 years ago. I will return and bring friends.

data.title: Going Down Hill
data.text:
We were traveling through here in mid-April and met a friend for lunch.  We had done the same nearly a year ago and at that time we enjoyed a good meal.  

This was not the case today, our meal was sub-par,(very bland and un-appetizing)  the chips and salsa were really lacking, the service was slow and uncaring and it was just an uncomfortable stop.  

This is certainly not the place we remembered from a year ago.  We come through Nampa about once a year and now we will have to find a new and better place to dine.

data.title: worst place i ever ate
data.text: took longer to be seated than usual been eating there for a long time seem like its been going down hill for a while made a last ditch effort to see if it was just me. the straw that broke the camels back was we got no water, even after asking for it didn't get the full order and our food was burned, told them this was not acceptable and they brought me onions and bell peppers that were fresh cooked ( what the hell the whole plate was burned shrimp chicken and beef) I told my wife happy mothers day you got the crappy dish at chapalas on Nampa Caldwell blvd.  they could have resolved it by redoing it, they didn't offer it. They didn't even offer it pay for it. I'm not cheep but I know what you have to do to fix something gone wrong I paid for everything else but the plate and no tip$$$ FAVIO AND MARIGTO I WILL NEVER RETURN TO YOUR PLACE AGAIN, Kuna I hear has a good Mexican restaurant better than yours EL GALLO GIRO I don't mind paying for what I get, but this was just crap see you in kuna

data.title: Nothing Special Here
data.text:
Most over priced Mexican Food in Nampa. Look around no Hispanics here other than wait staff.
No Lunch specials here on weekends, other local Mexican restaurants highlight there lunch specials.  Last time I was there, had a large group on Sunday, chips came in repeatedly smaller baskets. Pico degio was bland and watery. Food is greasy and poorly prepared. Margaritas are watery and poor quality . Watch the 18.5 % gratuity for groups.

data.title: Typical but tasty
data.text: Came for lunch and would return. Since I was with a group of 8, and none of us had any complaints about the quality of the food I would definitely give it another try. The chicken and beef dishes were well seasoned (not overly salted, but seasoned) and the dips were tasteful. You can get slightly better Mexican food but you will pay much too. Very good.

data.title: Good Mexican food
data.text: Very comparable to other Mexican chain restaurants I've been to. Maybe better, chapala has more options and they cook their food better.

data.title: A great place to eat!
data.text: Five of us decided to try Chapala's after golf and the food was out quickly and was outstanding. Better chips and salsa at other places but these were adequate, but when the main meals came, we all were impressed. For me, I had quit chimichangas a while back because of the deep fried issues. Didn't need the grease and calories -- but they have grilled chimi's and they were outstanding! Everything fresh and hot with exceptional service to boot. I'd send my friends there.
